place_name: Ha Jung Woo: Never tell anybody outside the family
description: This exhibition features paintings created by Ha Jung-woo this year. Ha Jung-woo continues his work based on his interest in everyday objects and people. The characters in his works are expressed with simple lines, bright colors, and simplified shapes stand out. By emphasizing the eyes, nose, and mouth on exaggerated faces, the characters are injected with primitive vitality. In this exhibition, Ha Jung-woo shows the pure spirit and primitive power of primitive nature that he has long explored. The new works are inspired by carpet design and are composed of regular lines and geometric abstractions, emphasizing mystery and purity. By utilizing native patterns, we try to visually reveal the inner intuition of human beings. In addition, he interprets folk materials such as traditional Korean masks with modern sensibility and incorporates them into his works. Ha Jung-woo's works show people's efforts to restore the original purity of human beings and revitalize the sincerity and vitality of life in modern civilization. This exhibition traces the reinterpretation of primitive symbolic expressions, conveys resonance with the origin of human existence, and proposes new emotional discoveries.

address: Amorepacific Museum of Art, Seoul, Korea
description: The largest exhibition in Asia focusing on the spatial work of artist duo Elmgreen and Dragset. A special experience of discovering and completing hidden stories in life-sized installations such as swimming pools, houses and restaurants.
Jean Jullien, an Instagram superstar with 1.25 million followers, uses simple lines and colors to humorously present daily life and social issues around us.

A commercial and business area under construction in Sangam-dong, Mapo-gu, Seoul. While redeveloping the old Lanji landfill in Sangam-dong, Mapo-gu, and the nearby low-development tribal village, coal factory, and vacant land, it focuses on attracting various media-related industries. It is also a building-intensive industrial park in the center of the knowledge industry.

address: South Korea, Incheon, 인천광역시 중구 제물량로218번길 3 (해안동1가)
description: Incheon Art Platform is located in South Korea. It is a cultural space renovated on the basis of the old Nippon Yusen Co., Ltd., Sanyu Printing Factory, Picasso Studio, Yangwen Church and other relics. Ancient buildings in Western architectural style have become creative studios, archives, exhibition halls, etc. The Incheon Art Platform not only retains the original architectural structure, but also maximizes the history and culture of Incheon.
